verses.verse: Whither is thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> gone <S%H1980><s%>, O thou fairest <S%H3303><s%> among women <S%H802><s%>? Whither hath thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> turned <S%H6437><s%> him <S%H1245><s%>, That we may seek him with thee?

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is gone down <S%H3381><s%> to his garden <S%H1588><s%>, To the beds <S%H6170><s%> of spices <S%H1314><s%>, To feed <S%H7462><s%> in the gardens <S%H1588><s%>, and to gather <S%H3950><s%> lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
I am my beloved <S%H1730><s%>'s, and my beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine <S%H7462><s%>; He feedeth his flock among the lilies <S%H7799><s%>,
Thou art fair <S%H3303><s%>, O my love <S%H7474><s%>, as Tirzah <S%H8656><s%>, Comely <S%H5000><s%> as Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, Terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners <S%H1713><s%>.

Turn away <S%H5437><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> from me <S%H1992><s%>, For they have overcome <S%H7292><s%> me <S%H8181><s%>. Thy hair is as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%>, That lie <S%H1570><s%> along the side of Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.

Thy teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of ewes <S%H7353><s%>, Which are come up <S%H5927><s%> from the washing <S%H7367><s%>; Whereof every one hath twins <S%H8382><s%>, And none is bereaved among them <S%H7909><s%>.
Thy temples <S%H7541><s%> are like a piece <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> Behind <S%H1157><s%> thy veil <S%H6777><s%>.
There are threescore <S%H8346><s%> queens <S%H4436><s%>, and fourscore <S%H8084><s%> concubines <S%H6370><s%>, And virgins <S%H5959><s%> without number <S%H4557><s%>.

My dove <S%H3123><s%>, my undefiled <S%H8535><s%>, is but one <S%H259><s%>; She is the only one <S%H259><s%> of her mother <S%H517><s%>; She is the choice <S%H1249><s%> one of her that bare <S%H3205><s%> her <S%H1323><s%>. The daughters saw <S%H7200><s%> her <S%H833><s%>, and called her blessed; Yea <S%H4436><s%>, the queens and the concubines <S%H6370><s%>, and they praised her <S%H1984><s%>.

Who is she that looketh forth <S%H8259><s%> as the morning <S%H7837><s%>, Fair <S%H3303><s%> as the moon <S%H3842><s%>, Clear <S%H1249><s%> as the sun <S%H2535><s%>, Terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners <S%H1713><s%>?

I went down <S%H3381><s%> into the garden <S%H1594><s%> of nuts <S%H93><s%>, To see <S%H7200><s%> the green plants <S%H3><s%> of the valley <S%H5158><s%>, To see <S%H7200><s%> whether the vine <S%H1612><s%> budded <S%H5132><s%>, And the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> were in flower <S%H5132><s%>.
Before I was aware <S%H3045><s%>, my soul <S%H5315><s%> set <S%H7760><s%> me Among the chariots <S%H4818><s%> of my princely people <S%H5993><s%>.

Return <S%H7725><s%>, return <S%H7725><s%>, O Shulammite <S%H7759><s%>; Return <S%H7725><s%>, return <S%H7725><s%>, that we may look <S%H2372><s%> upon thee <S%H2372><s%>. Why will ye look upon the Shulammite <S%H7759><s%>, As upon the dance <S%H4246><s%> of Mahanaim <S%H4264><s%>?
